post.description:
2.1. *Types of On-boarding*
        1. Email Sign Up
            1. user must confirm email for access. 
        2. Facebook Sign Up
            1. Users are able to create an account that is connected to their Facebook account.
            2. First Name, Last Name, and photo should be pulled from Facebook to streamline onboarding.
        3. SMS Sign Up
            1. User inputs name into the system
            2. The user then inputs phone number for verification 
                1. Send Confirmation code
            3. Verification code is sent to phone
            4. Autofill passcode from the keyboard when entering the passcode sent via SMS (Only UI)
            5. Confirmation returns the user to the account creation page (Only UI)
                1. failure results in an error allowing the user to retype the code.
                2. The user must be able to resend the code. 
                3. Rich content - Code can be clicked with predictive test
        5. Google Sign up 
            1. Users are able to create an account that is connected to their Google account.
    2. Onboarding Process 
        1. User adds Name and profile (UserName, Name, Tell us about yourself, hometown, Gender?)
        2. User has Ability to use Geolocation when Onboarding
        3. Enter an Address when Onboarding (If visible)
        4. User can add Identity Tags when Onboarding
        5. User can add Interest Tags when Onboarding (if visible)
        6. User can upload a profile photo when Onboarding
            1. or an avatar
        7. User can add a phone number when Onboarding
        8. User has the option to add who referred them when Onboarding (How about usertype?)
To verify the user profile email id

1. Architectural Requirements 
    1. Login Options
        1. Admin will set via CMS which login option will be available as the default
            2. Email
